Package camzup.kotlin

Class KtClr

java.lang.Object
camzup.core.Color
camzup.kotlin.KtClr
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<Color>, java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Float>
public class KtClr
extends Color
implements java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Float>
Provides Kotlin operator overloading support for colors. Color operations retain the alpha channel of the left operand, or of the color they are mutating, so these operations are not commutative.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    static class  KtClr.ClrIterator
    An iterator, which allows a color's components to be accessed in an enhanced for loop.

    • KtClr

      public KtClr()
      The default constructor. Creates a white color.

    • KtClr

      public KtClr​(byte red, byte green, byte blue)
      Creates a color from bytes. In Java, bytes are signed, within the range [-128, 127] .
      Parameters:
      red - the red channel
      green - the green channel
      blue - the blue channel

    • dec

      public KtClr dec()
      Returns a new color decremented by IUtils.ONE_255, 0.003921568859368563f. For interoperability with Kotlin: --a (prefix) or a-- (postfix). Per the specification, does not mutate the color in place.
      Returns:
      the decremented vector
      See Also:
      minus(float)

    • div

      public KtClr div​(Color c)
      Returns a new color with the division of the instance by the right operand. For interoperability with Kotlin: a / b . Does not mutate the color in place.
      Parameters:
      c - the right operand
      Returns:
      the quotient
      See Also:
      Utils.clamp01(float)

    • unaryMinus

      public KtClr unaryMinus()
      Inverts a color by subtracting the red, green and blue channels from one. Similar to bitNot, except alpha is not affected. For interoperability with Kotlin: -a . Does not mutate the color in place.
      Returns:
      the negative
      See Also:
      Utils.max(float, float)

    • unaryPlus

      public KtClr unaryPlus()
      Returns a new color with the positive copy of the instance. For interoperability with Kotlin: +a . Does not mutate the color in place.
      Returns:
      the positive
      See Also:
      Utils.clamp01(float)
